title: Chelsea news: Christian Pulisic breaks club record with hat-trick vs Burnley
text:
Christian Pulisic made history on Saturday night (Picture: Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

Christian Pulisic became Chelsea’s youngest ever hat-trick scorer thanks to his superb performance against Burnley on Saturday evening.

The American scored his first three goals for the Blues at Turf Moor in his first Premier League start since August.

In doing so, at just 21 years and 38 days old, Pulisic broke the record for youngest player to net a hat-trick for the club, which was only set earlier this season.

Tammy Abraham became the youngest hat-trick scorer in Chelsea history just last month when he scored three in a 5-2 Premier League win over Wolves.

The England international was 21 years and 347 days old at the time, but his record is already consigned to history after Pulisic topped it.

‘I’m sure he’s not going to be too happy about that,’ said Pulisic. ‘But he’s a team player and this is a very special day for me.’

The former Borussia Dortmund star also became only the second American to score a hat-trick in the Premier League, following Clint Dempsey who netted three times for Fulham in a 5-2 win over Newcastle in 2012.

That makes him the youngest American to score a hat-trick in the English top flight, but not the youngest to score in the Premier League, with Jozy Altidore scoring for Hull at just 20 years, 92 days in 2010.

Pulisic has become the youngest player to do all sorts of things in his short career so far, including: to appear and score in a World Cup qualifier for USA, to captain USA, to score two goals in the German top flight and to play for Dortmund in the Champions League.

His three efforts, which came from both the left and right feet and his head, set his side on the way to a thoroughly impressive 4-2 victory over the Clarets, with Willian scoring the Blues’ fourth and Jay Rodriguez and Dwight McNeil grabbing consolations for the home side.
